meanings.definition: A person who is very skilled or successful at something.
meanings.sent1: The math whiz solved the problem in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She is a computer whiz and can fix any tech issue.
meanings.sent3: The baking whiz made a cake that was out of this world.
meanings.sent4: The gardening whiz's green thumb amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The young artist was a painting whiz, creating masterpieces effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To move quickly through the air with a high-pitched sound.
meanings.sent1: The toy plane whizzed through the sky.
meanings.sent2: I heard a bullet whiz past my ear.
meanings.sent3: The baseball whizzed by the batter, striking him out.
meanings.sent4: The cars whizzed by on the highway, leaving a trail of dust.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves whiz around in circles.

meanings.sent1: The puppy needed to whiz after drinking so much water.
meanings.sent2: I had to stop the car to let my son whiz behind a tree.
meanings.sent3: The little boy announced loudly that he needed to whiz.
meanings.sent4: The long road trip made everyone in the car need to whiz frequently.
meanings.sent5: The urge to whiz woke her up in the middle of the night.
